macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Major Indexes Mixed on January 29 with Tech Sell-Off
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.1% to 6,969.01, Nasdaq dropped 0.7% to 23,685.12 amid dramatic swings, while Dow rose 0.1% to 49,071.56. Microsoft tumbled sharply after earnings, offset partly by Meta gains.[1][2]

items.title: Microsoft Shares Plunge on Profit Report
items.summary: Microsoft experienced its worst day in years, falling 11.86% to $424.50 after profit report, dragging Nasdaq lower amid AI valuation concerns. Other movers included Meta gains, Intel collapse, and Moderna weakness.[2][3][4]

items.title: S&P 500 Continues Decline into January 30
items.summary: US500 (S&P 500 tracker) fell 0.60% to 6,936 on Jan 29 and further 0.43% to 6,939 on Jan 30, with broader US stocks lower led by tech sell-off. Year-to-date gains remain positive at around 1.8-2.1%.[1][2][4]

items.title: Markets Brace for Fed Decision Amid Earnings Season
items.summary: Stocks volatile ahead of Federal Reserve decision, with tech resilience in Nasdaq but weekly losses in Dow and S&P 500; notable moves in Tesla, IBM, Meta, Intel, and insurers on Medicare proposals. Gold, silver at records; Bitcoin rebounding.[3]

items.title: Commodity and FX Volatility with Precious Metals Surge
items.summary: Gold hit $5,300, silver past $116; oil rose on disruptions; FX saw EUR/USD reject 1.2000, AUD/USD strength, USD/JPY rebound amid dollar weakness. Bitcoin rebounds on institutional adoption ahead of Fed.[3]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Crashes to $81,000 Triggering $1.68 Billion in Liquidations
items.summary: Bitcoin plunged nearly 6% to $81,000 on January 30, 2026, amid a broad crypto market selloff, with over $1.68 billion in positions liquidated, primarily longs. Ethereum dropped over 6% below $2,700, driven by institutional ETF outflows of $818 million and repricing of Fed policy expectations.

items.title: Bybit Report Highlights Short-Term Crypto Volatility Spike from Fed Repricing
items.summary: Cryptocurrencies faced a 4.7% market cap wipeout as Bitcoin hit $81,000 and Ether fell below $2,700, with short-term implied volatility surging to 46% for BTC and 58% for ETH. Longer-dated volatility remained muted, signaling near-term uncertainty amid global risk asset selloff.

items.title: Bitcoin Hits New Yearly Low Below $82,000 as Ethereum Drops to $2,700
items.summary: On January 30 night, Bitcoin briefly traded near $81,000 before recovering to $82,700, while Ethereum fell below $2,700 amid $1.7 billion in total liquidations. The downturn coincided with broader market corrections including gold, silver, and stocks like Microsoft and Tesla.

items.title: Bitcoin Futures Drop to New Low for the Year on January 30
items.summary: February Bitcoin futures prices fell to a contract low and new yearly low in early trading on January 30, 2026, reflecting ongoing market pressure.

items.title: Crypto Market Sell-Off Deepens as Bitcoin Struggles at $83K
items.summary: Crypto markets extended losses into January 30 morning, with Bitcoin failing to hold $83,000 amid heightened macro uncertainty and risk asset declines.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NYC Mayor Mamdani to Terminate Faulty AI Chatbot Amid Budget Cuts
items.summary: New York City mayor Zohran Mamdani announced plans to shut down a Microsoft-powered AI chatbot that advised businesses to break the law, citing its unusability and $500,000 cost as part of budget-saving measures.

items.title: China Integrates AI Courses into School Curriculum as Mandatory Subject
items.summary: Schools in China are making AI education a required part of the school day, prompting discussions in the U.S. about potential impacts on students and declining computer science major rates.

items.title: Global AI Chip Market Projected to Reach $118 Billion by 2030
items.summary: The artificial intelligence chip market, valued at $21.3 billion in 2024, is expected to grow at a 33% CAGR through 2030, driven by AI adoption in industries like automotive and healthcare, with trends in advanced packaging and edge computing.

items.title: Travelers Insurance Surges AI Adoption, Reduces Call Center Staff by a Third
items.summary: Insurance giant Travelers is advancing its AI strategy with tools for 10,000 engineers, automating millions of transactions, and consolidating call centers, marking a shift to 'Innovation 2.0' powered by generative and agentic AI.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: GDC 2026 State of the Game Industry Report Reveals 33% of US Developers Laid Off in Past Two Years
items.summary: The Game Developers Conference released its annual survey showing one-third of US game workers were laid off over the last two years, with AAA studios hit hardest and 82% supporting unionization. Over 50% of developers now view generative AI as a net negative for the industry, up from last year.

items.title: Amazon Game Studios Head Departs Amid Company-Wide Layoffs of 16,000
items.summary: The head of Amazon Game Studios left as Amazon announced layoffs affecting 16,000 employees across the company. This comes alongside broader industry turmoil highlighted in recent reports.

items.title: Comcept Studio, Founded by Mega Man Creator Keiji Inafune, Shuts Down
items.summary: Comcept, known for Mighty No. 9 and founded by Keiji Inafune in 2010, has permanently closed its doors. The shutdown adds to ongoing studio closures in the industry.

items.title: Valve Faces £656 Million UK Lawsuit Over Steam's Market Dominance
items.summary: Valve is sued for £656 million (about $900 million USD) in the UK for allegedly abusing its dominance by enforcing restrictive terms on publishers and taking a 30% cut of Steam sales.

items.title: Nintendo Switch Versions of Dispatch to Feature Mandatory Censorship
items.summary: Upcoming game Dispatch will censor content like full-frontal nudity on Nintendo Switch 1 and 2 without toggle options, unlike other platforms.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Tesla Reports First Full-Year Revenue Decline and Profit Slump
items.summary: Tesla announced its first annual revenue drop and a 46% profit decline, prompting a strategic pivot to robotics and autonomous tech with a $2 billion investment in xAI and cuts to high-end vehicle production.

items.title: SK Hynix Surpasses Samsung in Annual Operating Profit
items.summary: SK Hynix beat Samsung Electronics in yearly operating profit for the first time, driven by strong demand for High Bandwidth Memory (HBM) chips.

items.title: Nvidia Invests $2 Billion in CoreWeave
items.summary: Nvidia committed $2 billion to AI cloud provider CoreWeave amid expansions in data centers, while exploring Intel foundries for future GPU production.

items.title: Memory Chipmakers Warn of Supply Crunch Until 2027
items.summary: Samsung and SK Hynix plan up to 100% price hikes for memory products due to extreme AI-driven demand expected to cause shortages through 2027.

items.title: Apple Reports Record Q1 Revenue and iPhone Sales
items.summary: Apple achieved record quarterly revenue, EPS, and iPhone sales, reaching 2.5 billion active devices amid a holiday sales boost.

items.title: Microsoft Posts Strong Q2 Results with 60% Profit Jump
items.summary: Microsoft reported robust Q2 financials including a 60% profit increase, alongside ongoing major investments in AI infrastructure.

items.title: Autonomous Electric Vehicles Set for Commercial Scaling in 2026
items.summary: AEVs are transitioning from pilots to commercial operations in 39 markets, backed by $18 billion in 2025 investments and advancing tech.
